Rite of Renunciation

Rite of Accord (Level 2)

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 4 Gnosis (spent on attempt)
Focus: A symbolic act of rejection or release tied to the curse (destruction of a token, burial, confession, offering, or ritual severance)
Participants: One Garou (witnesses optional)

Roll: Gnosis Roll (d20 + Max Gnosis rating)
DC: 15

On Success: End one curse currently affecting the Garou, as remove curse. If the curse affects the Garou directly, it ends immediately. If from a cursed item, this Rite breaks attunement so the item can be removed; the curse remains on the item and reasserts if attuned again.

Limitations: No effect on permanent curses; cannot remove curses tied to artifacts, deities, or cosmic forces; cannot undo permanent transformations; cannot remove curses from another creature; does not cleanse or destroy the cursed object itself.

On Failure: Gnosis spent. Curse remains. Cannot attempt this Rite again on the same curse for 7 days. Failure does not worsen the curse.

description.value:
Rite of Renunciation
Rite of Accord • Level 2

Gnosis Cost: 4
Time: 1 hour
Resolution: Gnosis Roll
DC: 15
Participants: One Garou (witnesses optional)
Focus: A symbolic act of rejection or release tied to the curse (destruction of a token, burial, confession, offering, or ritual severance)

Summary

The Rite of Renunciation allows a Garou to formally reject and sever a curse that binds them through supernatural means.

This Rite is an act of declaration and separation, not purification.

Effect

On a successful Gnosis roll, the Garou ends one curse currently affecting them, functioning as the remove curse spell.

If the curse affects the Garou directly, it ends immediately.

If the curse originates from a cursed magic item, this Rite breaks the Garou's attunement to the item, allowing it to be removed or discarded. The curse remains bound to the item and will reassert itself if the item is attuned to again.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Has no effect on permanent curses
  • Cannot remove curses tied to artifacts, deities, or cosmic forces
  • Cannot undo transformations that have already become permanent
  • Cannot be used to remove curses from another creature
  • Does not cleanse or destroy a cursed object itself

Failure

On a failed Gnosis roll:

  • The Gnosis is spent
  • The curse remains
  • The Garou cannot attempt this Rite again on the same curse for 7 days
  • Failure does not worsen the curse
